fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49323].
  {panel}

The exception {{com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.exception.CalendarException: calendar3.error.jiralink}} is only logged at a debug level. For troubleshooting reasons it would be good to have this logged at an error level.

Example of the stack trace:
{noformat}2015-02-26 06:27:39,460 DEBUG [http-bio-8443-exec-36762] [extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource] getResponseError Unable to load events of sub-calendar e293b0da-12e5-4ca6-8cfc-8a243362edf3
 -- url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | userName: eterekhov | referer: https://wiki.aligntech.com/calendar/mycalendar.action
com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.exception.CalendarException: calendar3.error.jiralink
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.AbstractJiraSubCalendarDataStore.getSubCalendarContentInternal(AbstractJiraSubCalendarDataStore.java:626)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.AbstractJiraSubCalendarDataStore.getSubCalendarContentInternal(AbstractJiraSubCalendarDataStore.java:72)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.ExternalCalendarDataStore.getSubCalendarContent(ExternalCalendarDataStore.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.getSubCalendarContentFromCalendarDataStore(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:206)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.getSubCalendarContent(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:154)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.findEvents(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:510)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.getEvents(CalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:469)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DelegatingCalendarDataStore.getEvents(DelegatingCalendarDataStore.java:517)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore.getEvents(InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore.java:602)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore.getEvents(InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DelegatingCalendarDataStore.getEvents(DelegatingCalendarDataStore.java:517)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultCalendarManager.getEvents(DefaultCalendarManager.java:438)
...{noformat}
fields.summary: "CalendarException: calendar3.error.jiralink" only logged at DEBUG level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49322].
  {panel}

I often have need to refer to calendar events in Confluence pages.
It would be great if I could create a link to a specific event.

One possible method (I'm guessing the least amount of work):
 - Generate a link from the event like you do with pages
 - The user makes a hyperlink to refer to that event
 - Clicking on the event opens the calendar with that day/event highlighted

Another method (likely more work):
 - Have a macro that behaves something like the HTML <time> tag.
 - It looks like just an event name and date
 - Rollover gives event details as an infotip
 - Clicking brings you to the calendar with the event highlighted
fields.summary: Provide a method to link to a calendar event.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49319].
  {panel}

Label of event would be different according to the event state.
For exemple :
- canceled event is dashed
- reported event has arrows in the label
- past event is in grey
fields.summary: Customize event label according to state
I shouldn't be prompted to set up team calendars while previewing in the editor
Unfriendly message on Confluence Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49316].
  {panel}

To be able to plan events properly for our team we are missing an easy overview in availability.

It would help a lot to view/plot the amount of (available)people in a Team.
!image-2015-10-28-15-34-42-771.png|thumbnail! 

The image is an Excel example to clarify, showing that "Piet" and "Kees" are available
fields.summary: Improve Team Calendar insight in availability
Provide mouse over for the events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49313].
  {panel}

Add some events.
Disable event types.
Events disappear from calendar.

Shouldn't these events remain, but perhaps with a default event type or something like "No event type selected"
fields.summary: Events removed when disabling event types.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49312].
  {panel}

Someone mistakenly deleted a calendar.  Confluence sent a notification stating it had been deleted and also included an .ics file.  I assumed this was an export of the calendar prior to deletion because the email mentioned importing the file to restore the calendar.

Unfortunately, the .ics file was empty, in other words it had no events in it.  When I imported it to Confluence the calendar was blank.  I imported it to Outlook at got a warning saying there were no events.

I searched Atlassian Answers and looked through the TEAMCAL project issues, but didn't find anything describing this exact problem.  Has it been addressed in a newer version?

If not, please fix the bug so that the file Confluence emails is an accurate export of the calendar data.

Many Thanks!
fields.summary: .ics file is empty when imported

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49311].
  {panel}

Probably not a super common case but I've created Team Cals but have now moved on from the team. There doesn't seem to be way for me to unsubscribe or change the "ownership" of the cals to someone else.

This means that the events of things I don't need to care about any more still appear on my Connie front page

*Reporter*: Chai
*E-mail*: [mailto:mark@atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Changing owners of Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49310].
  {panel}

as a admin:
- create a admin view showing a list of all calendars, sorted by name
 - creator with the ability to update
 - timezone

 - list of watchers (analytics)
 - description with edit ability
 - delete/add calendar for admin view
 - edit all calendar details in admin view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49309].
  {panel}

I think this is a normally scenario
# Create a calendar
# Set reminder time for Travel event type
# Create a travel event

Actual
* The Travel event type is not remind user. (It means default value: not remind)

Expected
* Default value: remind user

Improve the performance of loading subcalendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49306].
  {panel}

I thought we had decided this a while ago, but I noticed we haven't done it yet.

You should be able to pick the event icons for
* Event
* Travel
* Leave
* Birthdays 
* Sprints
* JIRA box

as well as our custom icons, no reason why not to
I think the only one we shouldn't allow is the actual JIRA logo icon, keep that one for JIRA only
fields.summary: You should be able to use the existing icon types as custom icons, except for JIRA
Ability to Query a calendar
Setting issue to "done" or "complete" could automatically remove it from Calendar
Deleting a space removes all team calendars related to that space
Unable to add groups to calendar events
it should be better if we could remember the current view of shared calendar
Ability to Change the Time-Frame for Weekly View
Display events a normal page based on the "My Calendars" settings of the logged in user
Ability to only display certain event types on a Team Calendar
Calendar thinks I am watching it but I'm not
improve permission in Team Calendars
Event start and end times in Calendar List View

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49292].
  {panel}

Right now JIRA versions can be manifested only as single day event. It would be great if user could decide to show duration instead for all versions having both start and release date set.

This will help with:
* Planning - users can clearly see how much time they have
* Situation awareness - users may propose rescheduling, refactoring...whatever.
fields.summary: Allow user to show JIRA version duration
Set "event" as done once it's past the the time
Ability to Change 'Calendars' Header
Add ability to set number of days under Upcoming Events on the Confluence dashboard
Display time in list view
If a Calendar is in a space, opening the email should open the space instead of preview calendar
Allow site-admins to manage calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49281].
  {panel}

We've had users coming to us that really want the option to include more than one Related Page link when they are creating an event in Team Calendars. 

They want to be able to have their events linking to 2+ confluence pages rather than the default option of 1 Related Page. They use their team calendar events for displaying specs of promotions and also want to be able to add another link to a results page to give the event more historical meaning.

At the moment they are adding an extra link in the description field which doesn't aid ease of reading when describing the event nor does it render correctly (as per your open bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-997)

I envisage the option of clicking a + somewhere on the add event page to open additional Related Page fields where users can link through to other Confluence pages.

Please make it so!! :)
fields.summary: Add option to include more than one Related Page to a Team Calendar Event
Add SQL as datasource for Confluence Team Calendars
Show current time highlight in view mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49278].
  {panel}

Hello,

I would like to know if there is a possibility to insert Outlook calendar in Team Calendar?
It is possible to insert iCal file for bank holidays, but this is not possible for iCal from Outlook.
Is there a workaround for this?

Regards,
Tamara
fields.summary: Import Outlook calendar in Team Calendar in Confluence
Better explanation on each option
Team Calendars integration with Confluence Task List
Ability to configure displayed days for upcoming event in dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49271].
  {panel}

At the moment, when pulling issues through from JIRA, it only displays:
 * Ticket ID
 * Summary

with no additional information, nor a way to pull the additional information in without going to the actual ticket. 

This means that when an engineer looks at the calendar event, it shows no useful information without going into JIRA.

Would there be a facility in which we can define fields to show in the Calendar itself?
fields.summary: Change Information shown in Team Calendars when Referencing JIRA Ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49269].
  {panel}

h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Event
# Give the event a date in the future - For example, 1st January 2015.
# Set the event to repeat (any type of repeat is sufficient)
# Set the event to Repeat Until a certain date - 31st January 2015

h5.Expected Results
# The datepicker should default to at least the month my event starts in

h5.Actual Results
# The datepicker defaults to the current month

h5.Impact
This can be a pest if you're inputting dates long into the future, since you'll have to click through each month to get to at least the month you've created the event in.
fields.summary: The "Repeat Until" date field should use the event dates as a basis for it's starting date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49268].
  {panel}

# Create a page
# Add an event macro
# Input {Tunic size (Shirt size)} in custom field

Actual: this macro was not generated

!event macro.png!
fields.summary: Event macro in-line update doesn't include my data.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49266].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*

* User 1:
* create calendar
* create Event 1
* plan the event 1 to take place on 22.1.2016 whole day

* log in as a user 2
* add event 1 to take place on 22.1.2016 whole day

*Expected result:*
Conflict warning is displayed to user 2 before confirmation

Option to Add a Custom Link to a JIRA Release Event Type in TC
Improve repeating calendar events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49261].
  {panel}

We are currently evaluating Team Calendar, and face the following problem:

* We are exporting a calendar to Outlook.
* The elements were displayed, when I have synchronized or imported a Calendar, but I don't see the type of event there. Is it possible to see the type of event? Is it possible to include the type of event in the title of an entry?

We need that functionality to differentiate the entries, e.g. to have the information if the employee is on a journey or on vacation. It is not possible all the time to have separate calendars for different event types, so the information about the event type should be visible in the export format.
fields.summary: Is it possible to configure display (include type)
Login & approve message doesn't really make sense - not sure why I would log in
Reminder text in event create should say the reminder time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49258].
  {panel}

I would like a view to see all Calendars, with these fields. This could be used by a admin or even a users to see what calendars are out there and who is the owner, etc. I see this as a critical feature for admins.

Calendar Name
Calendar Creator
Calendar Description
# of events (total)
# of subscribers
# possible list the event types and number of events
# possible list the permisisons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49257].
  {panel}

Current behaviour
# Create a new event
# Select Leave event type then input all required items
# Select Birthday
* => The repeat field shows Yearly (It's OK)
# Select other event types such as Travel 
* => The repeat field still shows Yearly (It's not good, users usually change to do not repeat)

Expected
* => The repeat field should show "Do not repeat" (the recent value of Travel)
fields.summary: [Create an event] it should keep recent values of others when switch to birthday
As an administrator I would like invalid JQL to be logged as WARN or INFO rather than ERROR

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49255].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if two users edit the same event on a Team Calendar and save it at the same time, Confluence will save only the changes done by one of the users.

h3. Suggested Solution
We could provide a way to resolve this by either locking other users from editing when a user is editing a Calendar automatically, or we could provide a 'lock' for users to be able to lock Calendars before editing them.
 
h3. Workaround 
Manually lock this Calendar down by editing the restrictions. This can be cumbersome especially for Calendars with many permissions:
# Go to the calendar
# Restrict the calendar only to that single user
# Edit/add any events
# Remove restrictions
fields.summary: Extend restrictions in Team Calendars to allow only one user to edit at a time
Increase event reminder options for Team Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49253].
  {panel}

h3.Steps 

 # Navigate to a space's "PSRV" Calendar, ex https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/PSRV/calendars#
 # Click Add Event
 # Select Start and End dates and notice that the end date can't change

 *What happened...* 
Nothing...

 *What should have happened...*
The date should change to what was selected in the calendar widget.
fields.summary: Can't Select Dates in Space Calendar "Add Event"
Need Fix. Notification of the creation events of type "Custom Event Types" come without a signature who is assigned to the event
Ability to copy an event multiple teams - have the same event but no consistent recurring time
I was looking for reminder time here
Should remove link of 'BETA' text for TeamCal in space
Create Jira issue when adding jira event
Embedded calendar menu should have "Details" item
Restrictions on calendar type
Ability to convert table with dates into calendar events
Allow annoymous user to use the Team Calendar
Clicking on space calendar event notification lozenge should set focus/scroll to the day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49237].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Install Confluence and Team Calendar
 # Create a new space (eg: Space A)
 # Create multiple users that are not administrator (eg: johnsmith and janesmith)
 # Create new page in Space A (eg: sample page1)
 # Create a calendar into the sample page 1 (eg: calendar1)
 # Ensure johnsmith watch the entire Space A
 # Login as janesmith and add new event in the calendar1

 

*Current Behaviour*

johnsmith will receive notification that new event has been added into calendar1 even though the user does not personally  subscribe or utilize the calendar. 

 

*Desirable Behaviour*

Allow johnsmith to have option not to receive notification from all calendar in the space. This is because it is excessive and not all calendar from the space is important for specific user.
fields.summary: Have Option for Space Watcher to Opt Out of Calendar Notification
Team Calendar email seems to mix up data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49234].
  {panel}

# Remove eye ball icons
# Change "..." icon to drop down icon
# Change hide/show behavior:
   - parent calendar will have hide/show in drop down menu
   - events will hide/show when clicking
fields.summary: Amend UI for Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49233].
  {panel}

h3. Problem statement
Currently, if we have 2 events created on the same day at the same time, a single mail notification reminder is sent for both the events.

h3. Suggestion
Send separate e-mails for separate events instead of putting them together in a single e-mail.
fields.summary: Send separate e-mail notifications for different events on the same day or time
Export and Import The Whole Calendar Data in Confluence Instance
Allow 12-hour clock entry based on user, not on calendar
Ability to change page related texts
Ability to view reporter of JIRA issues in Team Calendars
Add explanatory text to the rebuild space calendars tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49222].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

If an event is updated many times within a short timeframe then many emails are sent. It'd be good to delay the notifications so that end users only receive the final update and not all the intermediate ones.

h3. Suggested Solution

If a user is to be notified about a specific event multiple times in a few minutes then delay those notifications and just send the last one.
 
h3. Workaround

Attempt to make as few changes to your events as possible to avoid too many emails.
fields.summary: Delay Notifications for event updates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49221].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* "Who" field is not  required when creating an Event Type: EVENT
*  When creating an EVENT in TC and tick "Repeat" (doesnt matter if it is daily, weekly, ...) the value "End Date: NEVER" is marked by default

h3. Suggested Solution
* Make the "Who" field required when creating an Event Type: EVENT for tracking purposes 
* Change the default value to "On Date: xxx" and  HIDE the NEVER button
fields.summary: Ability to edit some of the default fields
Way to temporarily suppress notifications on Team Calendars
Time zone display in Team Calendars is inconsistent and doesn't use UTC
Allow Custom Event Types to be re-used between calendars
Add offset timezone option when creating a new Calendar
Dashboard page does not handle errors in team cal very well.
Improve create event dialog
Ability to Purge Calendar Events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49212].
  {panel}

I'm involved in a couple of projects with their own team calendars in Confluence in different spaces. Rather than updating each one for my PTO, is there such a thing as a personal calendar in Confluence that can be linked to multiple  team calendars to expose events I want to share?

CURRENT:

I want to schedule a PTO day and have 5 different calendars or team I'm part of, using the current system I must had 5 separate events to 5 calendars but my view how shows 5 PTO's days for the same day.

PROPOSED:
i schedule a PTO from the create event, select "my personal" calendar, the PTO day is displayed on my personal calendar and any calendars I subscribe to
fields.summary: Personal calendar for individual events with a feed to other calendars
Possibility to use company official colors in Calendar
Add Event to Multiple Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49208].
  {panel}

It would be great if it is possible to restrict events to be seen by certain users only within a calendar.

The scenario would be like this :
# An admin have created a calendar for meetings for employees.
# Now all employees is added to this calendar
# Obviously all employees is able to see all events added in here.
# It would be nice if the events within that calendar can be restricted to certain users only. Which means that every user can see only events assigned to them.

This way everyone will get a better overview of their meetings. Of course this could be done by creating several calendars but it would be cumbersome to maintain.
fields.summary: ability to restrict events to certain users in a calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49207].
  {panel}

h3.Steps 

 # Create an event macro
 # Allow anonymous users
 # Add 2 people with same name, no email address provided

 *Was not allowed* 

 *Allowed to create this*
fields.summary: As a page editor, I would like to create an event that people are allowed to enter their name multiple times
Delete History / Audit Logs for Team Calendars
Permission control for creating new calendars
Badge with (0) next to calendars in space sidebar has no value for the user
calendar : one entry per event in view by list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49201].
  {panel}

Our customer gave us feedback that it would be great to have private events on a public calendar.
For an example, for a manager will be having a meeting with the board of directors today.
But he doesn't want his subordinates to know what kind of meeting he's having.

The users that don't have permission can only see the time slot being blacked out.
The users that have permission can see the event details.
fields.summary: Team Calendar public calendars with private events
Team Calendars should have a documentation about Rebuild Space Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49199].
  {panel}

Within a wider implementation of Team Calendars, we have one calendar for key 'events' for applications / services.  For example, if a very important demo is scheduled or if a period of 24/7 support is in place.  This calendar is a mix of project and operations events.

We also have a calendar that tracks similar events for a subset of projects.  This calendar is accessible by a specific group only and does not include operations events nor all project events.

I'd like to be able to display events that should appear on both calendars by selecting the calendars, rather than having to create two events and maintain these separately.  And it's not appropriate to give a particular group access to the other calendar (so that it can overlay the events) due to the fact that they shouldn't have permission to view all the other events too.

Is this functionality available?  If not, it is a new feature that we would very much like to see included in a future release of Team Calendars.

Thanks
fields.summary: Ability to show event on more than one calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49198].
  {panel}

Hi,

I need an quick overview of the estimations of the jira tasks in team calendar. It would help if its available in the popup when clicking on the issue, like in the screenshot attached. 

Thanks,
Edwin
fields.summary: See estimations in jira events
Establishing reoccurring events example: Every third Thursday of the month.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49196].
  {panel}

Scenario
* There are more than 30 calendars in the Confluence system. When user search with a keyword there are only 10 items displayed in the result list even if there's more than 10 items matched the search keyword.

* => So the expected Calendar may not be in this result list.

* To workaround, try to search with more specific keyword or put the search keyword in between double quote ("search keyword")

*Expected:*
* We should move this value from fixed value to configurable value in TC administration page that allows admin user change it
* We should provide a warning message like this "By changing this value bigger than 20 may affect to the system performance." when user set this number so big

!Screen Shot 2014-11-05 at 10.18.12 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Limitation of search result list is fixed instead of configurable value
Ability to create/link events so that if one event changes, it effects the timing of the linked events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49194].
  {panel}

At the moment when you add a JIRA Project release event, it only includes the release date, for example

20 Oct 2014 to 20 Oct 2014

The 2nd date is greyed out, but if you change the 1st date to an earlier day it changes the 2nd one also. I believe this is due to the fact it won't span across multiple days.

With this changed, you could show the entire duration of a release cycle.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Project Release Event type to span across multiple dates
Adding recurring events on same day of each month
